page.title: 14HEBBURN SHIPYARDS
page.content: We went to Swan Hunter's{shipyards}one day. 12 people went and I was one of them. We questioned a man from the gate. He told us he'd worked in shipyards for 40 years and seen many changes. We walked past giant cranes holding massive electromagnets. In the assembly shop there were gigantic rollers which roll pieces of sheet metal along. Next there was a machine to cut the metal and a machine to bend it. One crane there was able to pick up 126 tons of metal. We walked on to the{dry dock.} It is one of the biggest on the river. We walked back to the gate passing the canteen on the way. There are now only 50 men working there. They are waiting for orders for new ships.
